summary.span: 为实现 的线程安全集合提供阻塞和限制功能。

span.span: Provides blocking and bounding capabilities for thread-safe collections that implement .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个线程安全集合类, 可提供以下内容: is a thread-safe collection class that provides the following: - 生成者/使用者模式的实现;是接口的包装。An implementation of the producer/consumer pattern; is a wrapper for the interface. - 利用 和方法并发添加和移除多个线程中的项。Concurrent addition and removal of items from multiple threads with the and methods. - 当集合已满或为空时阻止和操作的绑定集合。A bounded collection that blocks and operations when the collection is full or empty. - 使用或方法中的对象取消或操作 。Cancellation of or operations by using a object in the or method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型, 请`try` / `catch`在块中调用其方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息, 请参阅接口主题中的 "使用实现 IDisposable 的对象" 一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 另请注意, 该方法不是线程安全的。Also, note that the method is not thread-safe. 的所有其他公共和受保护的成员都是线程安全的, 可从多个线程并发使用。All other public and protected members of are thread-safe and may be used concurrently from multiple threads. 表示一个集合, 该集合允许对数据进行线程安全的添加和删除。 represents a collection that allows for thread-safe adding and removal of data. 用作实例的包装, 并允许集合中的删除尝试在数据可用之前被阻止。 is used as a wrapper for an instance, and allows removal attempts from the collection to block until data is available to be removed. 同样, 你可以创建来对中允许的数据元素的数目执行上限; 然后, 对集合的加法尝试会被阻止, 直到有可用空间来存储添加的项。Similarly, you can create a to enforce an upper bound on the number of data elements allowed in the ; addition attempts to the collection may then block until space is available to store the added items. 采用这种方式时, 与传统的阻塞队列数据结构类似, 只是基础数据存储机制是抽象掉的。In this manner, is similar to a traditional blocking queue data structure, except that the underlying data storage mechanism is abstracted away as an . 支持限制和阻塞。 supports bounding and blocking. 边界意味着可以设置集合的最大容量。Bounding means that you can set the maximum capacity of the collection. 在某些情况下, 边界非常重要, 因为它使你能够控制内存中的集合的最大大小, 并可防止生成线程在占用线程之前太远。多个线程或任务可同时向集合添加项, 如果集合达到其指定最大容量, 则生成线程将被阻止, 直到删除了某个项。Bounding is important in certain scenarios because it enables you to control the maximum size of the collection in memory, and it prevents the producing threads from moving too far ahead of the consuming threads.Multiple threads or tasks can add items to the collection concurrently, and if the collection reaches its specified maximum capacity, the producing threads will block until an item is removed. 多个使用者可以同时移除项，如果集合变空，则使用线程将发生阻塞，直到制造者添加某个项。Multiple consumers can remove items concurrently, and if the collection becomes empty, the consuming threads will block until a producer adds an item. 生成线程可以调用方法来指示不再添加项。A producing thread can call the method to indicate that no more items will be added. 使用者将监视 属性以了解集合何时为空且不再添加项。Consumers monitor the property to know when the collection is empty and no more items will be added. 和操作通常是在循环中执行的。 and operations are typically performed in a loop. 可以通过 将对象传入或方法, 然后在每次迭代时检查标记的属性的值, 来取消循环。 You can cancel a loop by passing in a object to the or method, and then checking the value of the token's property on each iteration. 如果值为`true`, 则由您通过清理所有资源并退出循环来响应取消请求。If the value is `true`, it is up to you to respond the cancellation request by cleaning up any resources and exiting the loop. 创建对象时, 不仅可以指定限定容量, 还可以指定要使用的集合类型。When you create a object, you can specify not only the bounded capacity but also the type of collection to use. 例如, 您可以为先进先出 (FIFO) 行为指定对象, 或为后进先出 (LIFO) 行为指定对象。For example, you could specify a object for first in, first out (FIFO) behavior, or a object for last in, first out (LIFO) behavior. 可使用实现 接口的任何集合类。You can use any collection class that implements the interface. 的默认集合类型为 。The default collection type for is . 请勿直接修改基础集合。Do not modify the underlying collection directly. 使用方法可添加或删除元素。Use methods to add or remove elements. 如果直接更改基础集合, 则对象可能会损坏。The object can become corrupted if you change the underlying collection directly. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从阻止集合中同时添加和取出项:The following example shows how to add and take items concurrently from a blocking collection: [!code-csharp[System.Collections.Concurrent.BlockingCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.blockingcollection/cs/blockingcoll.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Concurrent.BlockingCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.blockingcollection/vb/blockingcoll.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks CopyTo 表示精确时间点的集合快照。CopyTo represents a snapshot of the collection at a precise point in time. 如果其他线程在执行 CopyTo 的同时添加或删除项, 则 CopyTo 返回的元素可能不表示集合的状态。If other threads are adding or removing items while CopyTo is executing, then the elements returned by CopyTo might not represent the state of the collection.

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法`Dispose`不是线程安全的。The `Dispose` method is not thread-safe. 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用`Dispose`后, 必须释放对的所有引用, 以便垃圾回收器能够回收占用的内存。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.
